page.title: 13NEW HALL BOREHAM 3 RIDING
page.content: New Hall School Riding Centre is within the grounds of New Hall, but it is a self-contained unit. The facilities include a flood-lit indoor school (40meters by 20) with seating for 80 in the gallery.An automatic sprinkler system is installed. Added to these facilities is an outdoor menage. outdoor paddocks are used for jumping and cross-country. There is stabling for 27 horses in the main Centre and for eight more in the annexe. It is a BHS Examination Centre, and a training Centre for 'Riding for the Disabled' There is a working pupil scheme, and up to 10 working pupils are taken at one time. Cost of lessons for one hour range from Â£5.00. for a group lesson to Â£11.00. for a private lesson with Head of Riding.
